user_stories.title: User Account Creation
user_stories.description: As a new user, I want to create an account using my email and password so that I can start tracking my micro-habits and have my data stored securely.
acceptance_criteria: User can navigate to a sign-up screen.
User can enter an email address and password.
User can confirm their password.
Upon successful submission, a user account is created.
User is redirected to the main dashboard or onboarding.
An error message is displayed if the email is already in use or passwords do not match.

user_stories.title: User Login
user_stories.description: As a registered user, I want to log in with my email and password so that I can securely access my habit tracking data.
acceptance_criteria: User can navigate to a login screen.
User can enter their registered email and password.
Upon successful login, the user is directed to the dashboard.
An error message is displayed for incorrect credentials.

user_stories.title: User Logout
user_stories.description: As a logged-in user, I want to be able to log out of the application so that I can ensure my data remains private on shared devices.
acceptance_criteria: There is a clear option to log out (e.g., in settings or profile menu).
Initiating logout returns the user to the login/signup screen.
The user's session is terminated.

user_stories.title: Create a Micro-Habit
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to create a new micro-habit by providing a name, frequency, and optional description, so that I can start tracking small, achievable actions.
acceptance_criteria: User can access an 'Add Habit' or 'Create Habit' function.
User can input a unique name for the habit.
User can select the frequency of the habit (e.g., daily, specific days of the week).
User can optionally add a description for more context.
The new habit is saved and appears on the main dashboard.

user_stories.title: Log Daily Habit Completion
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to easily mark a micro-habit as completed for the day so that I can track my consistency and build positive streaks.
acceptance_criteria: Each habit on the dashboard has a clear interactive element (e.g., button, checkbox) to mark it as done.
Tapping this element marks the habit as completed for the current day.
Visual feedback is provided upon successful completion (e.g., element changes state, animation plays).
The streak counter for that habit increments accordingly.

user_stories.title: View Current Streaks on Dashboard
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to see a dashboard that displays all my active micro-habits along with their current streak counts and animated visualizations, so that I can quickly monitor my progress and stay motivated.
acceptance_criteria: The main dashboard screen lists all active micro-habits.
For each habit, the current consecutive streak (number of days) is clearly visible.
Animated visualizations are displayed to represent the streaks (e.g., a growing flame, a filling bar).
The dashboard updates in near real-time after a habit is checked in.
Habits are visually distinct and easy to identify.

user_stories.title: Set Daily Reminders for Habits
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to set customizable daily reminders for my micro-habits so that I don't forget to check them in.
acceptance_criteria: When creating or editing a habit, the user has the option to enable and configure a daily reminder.
User can specify the time for the reminder.
The app sends a push notification at the scheduled time.
Users can enable or disable reminders for individual habits.
Reminders are delivered accurately at the set times.

user_stories.title: Data Synchronization Across Devices
user_stories.description: As a user, I want my habit data (habits, check-in history, streaks) to be automatically synced across all my devices using Firestore, so that I can access my progress seamlessly regardless of which device I'm using.
acceptance_criteria: All user data is stored in a Firestore database.
When a user logs in on a new device, all their existing habit data is fetched and displayed.
Changes made on one device (e.g., adding a habit, checking in) are reflected on other logged-in devices within a reasonable time.
The sync process is reliable and maintains data integrity.

user_stories.title: Offline Data Handling
user_stories.description: As a user, I want the app to function and allow me to check in to habits even when I am offline, with data syncing automatically once I reconnect, so that my tracking is never interrupted.
acceptance_criteria: The app caches habit data locally.
Users can perform check-ins while offline.
The app visually indicates that the device is offline.
Once an internet connection is re-established, pending offline check-ins are automatically synced to Firestore.
The dashboard reflects the synced data upon successful connection.

user_stories.title: View Detailed Habit History
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to view a detailed history for each habit, including past completion dates and my longest streak, so that I can gain deeper insights into my performance over time.
acceptance_criteria: User can tap on a habit from the dashboard to navigate to a detailed view.
This view displays the current streak.
This view displays the all-time longest streak for that habit.
A calendar or timeline visualization shows the days the habit was completed.
The historical data presented is accurate.

user_stories.title: Edit Habit Details
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to be able to edit the name, frequency, and reminder settings of my existing micro-habits so that I can adapt them as my routine evolves.
acceptance_criteria: An 'Edit' option is available for each habit (e.g., on the habit detail screen).
User can modify the habit's name, frequency, and reminder time.
Saving the changes updates the habit details across the app and in storage.
Editing a habit does not reset its current streak unless the frequency change logically breaks it.

user_stories.title: Archive or Delete Habits
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to archive or delete habits I no longer track so that I can keep my dashboard clean and focused.
acceptance_criteria: An option to 'Archive' or 'Delete' a habit is available.
Archiving removes the habit from the main dashboard but retains its history.
Deleting permanently removes the habit and all its associated data.
A confirmation prompt is shown before executing delete or archive actions to prevent accidental data loss.

user_stories.title: Password Reset Functionality
user_stories.description: As a user who has forgotten their password, I want to be able to reset it securely so that I can regain access to my account.
acceptance_criteria: A 'Forgot Password?' link is present on the login screen.
User can enter their registered email address to initiate the reset.
An email with instructions or a reset link is sent to the user.
User can follow the email instructions to set a new password.
The new password allows the user to log in successfully.

user_stories.title: Apply Purchased Customizations
user_stories.description: As a user who has made an in-app purchase, I want to apply premium themes and icon packs to personalize the app's appearance and my habits.
acceptance_criteria: A section exists for managing purchased customizations (themes, icons).
User can select and apply a purchased theme.
User can select and apply purchased icons to their habits.
The app's UI and habit representations update to reflect the chosen customizations.
Applied customizations persist across app sessions and devices for the logged-in user.

user_stories.title: Utilize Habit Templates
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to select from pre-defined habit templates during habit creation to quickly set up common micro-habits.
acceptance_criteria: An option to 'Use Template' is available during habit creation.
A catalog of available templates is displayed.
Selecting a template pre-populates the habit name, frequency, and potentially duration/action.
User can then save the habit directly or modify the pre-filled details before saving.

user_stories.title: Categorize Habits
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to group my habits into categories (e.g., Wellness, Productivity) so that I can organize them better and view them selectively.
acceptance_criteria: User can create, name, and assign habits to categories.
The dashboard allows filtering or viewing habits by category.
Habits can be assigned to multiple categories or have no category.
Editing a habit allows changing its category.

user_stories.title: Data Export
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to export my habit tracking data (e.g., to a CSV file) so that I can analyze it externally or keep a personal backup.
acceptance_criteria: An option to 'Export Data' is available (likely in settings).
User can choose a date range or export all data.
The data is generated in a common format like CSV.
User can share or save the exported file.

user_stories.title: Home Screen Widget Access
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to have home screen widgets that allow for quick check-ins and viewing of my current streaks so that I can interact with the app without fully opening it.
acceptance_criteria: Users can add MicroHabitFlow widgets to their device's home screen.
Widgets display current streak information for selected habits.
Widgets provide a button or tap area to quickly mark a habit as complete.
Widgets update their displayed information periodically or upon app interaction.
